New York University Abu Dhabi Library
Hisham Khatib Collection
Khatib, Hisham, Mr.
AD.MC.030
10.0 Paige boxes
1880s - 1920s Digital copy only
Biographical / Historical
The Hisham Khatib Collection on the Holy Land and region is one of the largest collections of Middle Eastern photography still in private hands. It contains thousands of 19th century original albumen photographic prints as well as many travel albums of the same period and early 20th century with hundreds of black and white photographs and postcards. The collection contains photography from dozens of photographers, but the albumen prints are mostly the work of the Bonfils family, Francis Frith, Francis Bedford, Underwood and Underwood Co., Photoglob of Zurich, Mendel John Diness, The Vester & Co. – American Colony, Khalil Ra'ad, Peter Bergheim, Zangaki Brothers, and Frank Mason Good.
Dr. Hisham Khatib has spent over 40 years amassing a vast and historically valuable collection of representations of the Near East, including the Holy Lands, including Palestine, Jordan, Turkey, Syria and Egypt. The artworks in this extraordinary collection include paintings, prints, maps, books, photographs, as well as postcards. A large part of Dr. Khatib's collection consists of rare photographic prints: he has over 6000 images, 3000 of which are in albums. Palestine - Bonfils, Zangaki, L.
